laboratory_examinations.findings: Plasma osmolality rose to 315 mosmol/kg; urinary osmolality was 400 mosmol/kg; plasma VP concentration was 1.3 pg/mL (normal is >8 pg/mL at this osmolality). Greater than 50% increase in urinary osmolality after administration of exogenous VP confirmed the diagnosis.
Plasma osmolality reached 307 mosmol/kg, with maximum urinary osmolality of 305 mosmol/kg and plasma VP of 0.33 pg/mL (normal >0.5 pg/mL).
